We regard Nursery B as our highest priority application outside of our absolute top choice. We formally submit our application now and eagerly await your decision.

Given that we are in Round 6 and I have the lowest priority (P5) at Nursery_B, delaying an application further risks losing the spot if a higher-priority parent decides to apply, or if Nursery_B accepts a lower-ranked parent who applies sooner. Since I view Nursery_B as an excellent fit, it is time to formalize my interest. If I am accepted, I secure my P2 choice. We have carefully reviewed your profile and our team is highly impressed with the potential fit. We are delighted to officially offer your child a placement at Nursery B. conversation.thought: I am Nursery_B, and my quota is 1. My priority list ranks Parent_E last (5th), but Parent_D (4th) is the only other remaining candidate. Parents A, B, and C are presumably matched elsewhere. While Parent_D is higher on my priority list, Parent_E has formally submitted an [APPLY] and confirmed Nursery_B is their second choice, showing high commitment. Given the simulation is in Round 6 and the risk of both remaining parents matching with their higher preferences (Parent_D prefers D, A, C; Parent_E prefers E) is high, securing the guaranteed match with Parent_E, who is highly motivated, outweighs the small potential rank gain of holding out for Parent_D, who has only engaged in [TALK] rounds so far.
